description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dlkag","text":"The DNA extraction protocol described in this document follows the standard protocol provided with the Zymobiomics DNA miniprep kit (https://files.zymoresearch.com/protocols/_d4300t_d4300_d4304_zymobiomics_dna_miniprep_kit.pdf) with a few modifications. The protocol is part of the project \"DNA-metabarcoding of marine phytoplankton\" funded by the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency and the Swedish Agency for Marine and Water Management. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":133,"length":93},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":348,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":93},{"key":1,"offset":291,"length":41},{"key":2,"offset":348,"length":39},{"key":3,"offset":396,"length":46}],"data":{}},{"key":"dpbae","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d616","text":"Phytoplankton play a key role in global biogeochemical cycles and form the basis of marine food webs. Quantitative assessment of the abundance and biodiversity of phytoplankton is therefore a natural component of environmental monitoring programs. Until now such monitoring has largely been based on microscopic counting. This is a time consuming process and requires personnel with high skill for identifying the organisms, and the smallest cells can hardly be identified with this method. There is hence an urge for faster, more precise and reproducible ways of quantifying plankton species in environmental samples. High-throughput sequencing of taxonomic marker genes (metabarcoding) has emerged as a popular alternative for studying plankton diversity. However, also this method has its limitations, and in order to be robustly implemented in monitoring programs, protocols need to be optimised and validated. The main goal of the project is to evaluate high-throughput sequencing as a tool to investigate the diversity of phytoplankon in the seas surrounding Sweden, with special focus on non-indigenous species and harmful algae. Specifically we want to test effects of storage of samples, sample volume, replication and background DNA in the water (“eDNA”), develop and evaluate an improved method for identifying phytoplankton based on sequencing a longer region of the rRNA operon and compare results from metabarcoding with results from microscope-based methods. The tests will be conducted on water samples collected as part of the Swedish National Marine Monitoring programme. This will provide a large data set covering all major sea areas surrounding Sweden and allow us to compare the metabarcoding results with taxonomic identifications obtained using microscopy as part of the monitoring programme. This collaborative project will be conducted by a team of researchers with complementary expertise in plankton ecology, marine monitoring, molecular biology and bioinformatics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0E43128AA1AC11EB8ED10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://files.zymoresearch.com/protocols/_d4300t_d4300_d4304_zymobiomics_dna_miniprep_kit.pdf"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2AD3D180752411EC84B7D54FF06E06F6","url":"https://www.umu.se/en/research/projects/dna-metabarcoding-of-marine-phytoplankton/"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8A632B4CA1B311EB8ED10A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.swedishepa.se"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"78340D92A1B311EB8ED10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.havochvatten.se/en/start.html"}}}}

funders.funder_name: Swedish Agency for Marine and Water Management and the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency

keywords: ,DNA, plankton, barcoding, 16S, 18S, extraction, biomass, biodiversity,phytoplankton,ocean,marine,Baltic Sea,Kattegatt, Skagerakk,Baltic

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"agsbu","text":"Filter water samples onto 0.2 µm pore size Millipore filter (Merck Millipore; GSWP04700) attached to a filter funnel connected to a vacuum source. Filter a minimum of 500 ml collected seawater. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5devb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkmlk","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2r6d9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3272p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vlpp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhjei","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"2F5FC0C0A20611EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"Seawater","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":317,"style":"italic"}],"key":"ambq6","text":"Filter up to 500 ml of seawater at a pressure less than 200mm Hg/267mbar/27kPa. Try to keep the filtration time below 60 minutes. Start the filtration as close to sampling as possible preferably within 60 minutes. If it is not possible to start filtration within 60 minutes then incubate the water sample at close to in situ temperature and take note of the incubation time.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kvna","text":"Clean your work bench with 70% ethanol.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ecmn","text":"Prepare sterilized forceps and petri dish on the bench.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b96f","text":"Prepare pipettes in varying sizes with filter tips.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hfb2","text":"Take out beakers for discarding liquids and used tips.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n3in","text":"Turn on the microcentrifuge and set the machine to 13000 x g for 1 minute.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tcrn","text":"Prepare Vortex with adapter plates and set timer for 10 minutes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3uaut","text":"Thaw filters in the sampling tubes at room temperature and add the filter cut into small pieces to a ZR BashingBead™ Lysis Tube (0.1 \u0026 0.5 mm). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":101,"length":41},{"style":"bold","offset":101,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbbam","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v4gn","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3t39","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d1p4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"77F8EFB0A1CE11EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"Filter thaw","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":18,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"7injq","text":"What’s happening? Cutting the filter membrane into the ZR BashingBead™ Lysis Tube allows for efficient bead beating and homogenization in proceeding steps.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1j22","text":"Using two sets of sterile forceps, pick up the filter membrane at opposite edges and roll the filter into a 2 ml cryo tube (Avantor, 479-1262) with the top side of the filter facing inward. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eifol","text":"Take note of station, date, sample ID, sampling time, time duration of filtration, filtered volume and any comments of potential use (such as filtration problems, colour of filter etc.).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4shdj","text":"Store the filters at minimum -20°C (short-term storage) or -80°C (long-term storage) no additional reagent for preservation is needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5isho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afvis","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a8304","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6s01v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"6A25D5A0A20611EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"Freezer storage","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":98,"offset":344}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":98,"offset":344,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"key":"6fc7b","text":"A preservation agent, DNA/RNA Shield™ (Zymo Research;R1103), can be used to simplify storage and downstream processing while increasing the possible storage time. In theory, filters stored in cryo tubes preserved with DNA/RNA Shield™ can be kept in room temperature for \u003e1 year until processing. For more information see separate protocol here https://files.zymoresearch.com/protocols/_r1100-50_r1100-250_r1200-25_r1100-125_dna_rna_shield.pdf. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"7E564D10A20311EB8ED10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://files.zymoresearch.com/protocols/_r1100-50_r1100-250_r1200-25_r1100-125_dna_rna_shield.pdf"},"mutability":"","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1108o","text":"Prepare spike-in genes using artificial 16S and 18S rRNA gene oligonucelotides (designed in-house and generated by Twist Bioscience). See sequences and sub-steps below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19ve6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6phmb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vgv3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ui2m","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ndal","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6te3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a69v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c0elp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":87,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"7bmds","text":"\u003e16SrRNA_gene_1447bp_ATGCfreq_E.coli NR_024570.1_primerbindingsites_341F_515F_805R_806R","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8uh18","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":195,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2lths","text":"\u003e18SrRNA_gene__ length1261_primersites_563f/V4fw-1563(18)_TAReuk454FWD-1564(20)_TAReukREV3-1991(18)_V4rev-2017(18)_1132r-2157(18)_V9dropfw_2205(22)_V9fw-2207(18)_V9droprev-2675(19)_V9rev-2676(18)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7cqlf","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7f1so","text":"The sequences are random but based on the GC content of a consensus 18S of the PR2 sequences and 16S on the  E.coli sequence. Both contain primer positions for several primer pairs (specified in the fasta header) that produce amplicons with a length to be expected from real samples. If needed it is easy to add other primer motifs.The oligonucleotides are delivered as a dry pellet with a concentration of 1000 ng. The goal concentration of spike-in genes is to reach around 5% of total 16S and 18S rRNA gene sequences in the final extracted sample of genomic DNA. Using results from metagenomic data across a whole season (both low and high biomass) the calculated amount of 16S and 18S rRNA gene material to be added to samples, regardless of season or biomass collected, is presented in Table 2.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"202b4","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4ac3","text":"TABLE 2. Calculated amount of spike-in 16S and 18S rRNA gene oligonucleotides, based on metagenomic data, to add in order to reach approximately 5% concentration in a given sample of extracted genomic DNA.  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dolmc","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":98,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"88qk2","text":"   Spike-in gene concentration 16S spike DNA to add (ng)18S spike DNA to add (ng)5 %0.002040.00729","type":"atomic"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"mpd8","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ks7","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"s0b2","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100],"data":[["Spike-in gene concentration ","16S spike DNA to add (ng)","18S spike DNA to add (ng)"],["5 %","0.00204","0.00729"]],"guid":"FCD758BDA20811EB8ED10A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Spike-in gene concentration ","16S spike DNA to add (ng)","18S spike DNA to add (ng)"],["5 %","0.00204","0.00729"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]},"mutability":"","type":"tables"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5r426","text":"Add 100 µl sterile filtered autoclaved MQ, DNase/RNase Free Water or TE buffer to the dry pellet bringing the stock solution to a concentration of 10 ng/µl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbn24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24dn5","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dj5rv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"2CB5A9D0A1CE11EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"MQ","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c463u","text":"Then, in sequence through continued serial dilution in steps of x 10 dilutions, prepare working solutions with the final concentration of the 16S and 18S spike-in DNA to 0.0002 ng/µl  and 0.0007 ng/µl, respectively, note the x 10 dilution for the final concentration compared to Table 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":170,"length":12},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":188,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ll43","text":"Aliquot and freeze working solution in batches at -20°C until processing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9npak","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d01mm","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vq8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"491CFF40A20711EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"Freezer storage","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25n4p","text":"Rinse the sampling tube with 750 µl and add the Lysis Solution into the ZR BashingBead™ Lysis Tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":48,"length":14},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":72,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg6sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e82oh","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":1,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"45njt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3v05i","text":"Note: For samples stored and lysed in DNA/RNA Shield™ Lysis buffer, do not add ZymoBIOMICS™ Lysis Solution and proceed to step 9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":38,"length":28},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":79,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":28},{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5had","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30hd2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"750","error":false,"guid":"C97E13B0A1CE11EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"ZymoBIOMICS Lysis Solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49kto","text":"Add 10 µl of the prepared dilutions of 16S and 18S spikes, and cap tightly. {"blocks":[{"key":"8ht1","text":"Transfer the Zymo-Spin™ IICR Column to a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube and add 50 µl ZymoBIOMICS™ DNase/RNase Free Water directly to the center of the column matrix and incubate in room temperature for 1 minute. DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":13,"length":22},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":47,"length":27},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":89,"length":35},{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":89,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qpar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqshj","text":" DNase/RNase Free Water","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"43FA6C70A20A11EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"1m","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"10000","duration":60,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C2BB1750A1D111EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"blboq","text":"What’s happening? Placing ZymoBIOMICS™ DNase/RNase Free Water (sterile elution buffer) in the center of the small white membrane will make sure the entire membrane is wetted. This will result in a more efficient and complete release of the DNA from the silica Spin Filter membrane. As ZymoBIOMICS™ DNase/RNase Free Water passes through the silica membrane, the DNA that was bound in the presence of high salt is selectively released by ZymoBIOMICS™ DNase/RNase Free Water which lacks salt. ZymoBIOMICS™ DNase/RNase Free Water contains no EDTA. If DNA degradation is a concern, sterile TE may also be used instead of ZymoBIOMICS™ DNase/RNase Free Water for elution of DNA from the Spin Filter.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38kre","text":"Place a Zymo-Spin™ III-HRC Filter in a NEW Collection Tube and add 600 µl ZymoBIOMICS™ HRC Prep Solution. Centrifuge at 8,000 x g for 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":8,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":39,"length":19},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":74,"length":30},{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m1it","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lpjo","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"du419","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mrds","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8c5fg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"DCE16D50A1D111EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"ZymoBIOMICS™ HRC Prep Solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"8000","duration":180,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E65159E0A1D111EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d17fe","text":"Place the prepared Zymo-Spin™ III-HRC Filter in a clean 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube. Make sure to mark the tube (both lid and side) clearly with a unique ID using a permanent marker resistant to freezing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":19,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":56,"length":27},{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5botm","text":"Transfer the eluted DNA (Step 20) to the Zymo-Spin™ III-HRC Filter and centrifuge at exactly 16,000 x g for 3 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":41,"length":25},{"style":"bold","offset":41,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmsmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68r0j","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1aslk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ijq1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lut3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6bm0d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"16000","duration":180,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0B529E20A1D211EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"dilpa","text":"What’s happening? TheZymoBIOMICS™ HRC Prep Solution includes PCR Inhibitor Removal technology enabling PCR from the most PCR prohibitive environmental samples rich in humic and fulvic acids, tannins, melanin, and other polyphenolic compounds.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7hig1","text":"Freeze extracted gDNA at -20°C or -80°C. Measure the concentration of the extracted DNA using Qubit Fluorometer; see separate protocol for Qubit provided by the manufacturer. The filtered DNA is now suitable for PCR and other downstream applications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":94,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96tv1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a01an","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1l07k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"181ADD70A1D211EBBDCC2526D88C4B97","id":0,"label":"Freezer storage","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}
